definition: to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: Hong Kong has three Banks issue currency, spend attention see denominations.
sentences.chinese: 香港有三家银行发行货币，花钱注意看清面额。

sentences.english: O.K., I think you get the picture.
sentences.chinese: 好了，我想你能看清未来图景了。

sentences.english: Now, I'm going to show you just how functional I am.
sentences.chinese: 现在，我要让你看清楚，我是纯爷们。

sentences.english: His hair was cut short, and his face appeared, in the gloom, to be hard and expressionless.
sentences.chinese: 短发，露出了脸，在黑暗中，难以看清表情。

sentences.english: Because the air is dry, clear weather, the far mountain just can see clear.
sentences.chinese: 因为空气干燥，天气晴朗，远山才可看清楚。

sentences.english: The hardest colors to look at together are red and blue.
sentences.chinese: 最难看清的颜色是将红色和蓝色放在一起。

sentences.english: Hand her a flashlight so she can see the way.
sentences.chinese: 给她一把手电筒让她看清道路。
生活是一场梦，你要看清它。

sentences.english: How could I be sure it was her when I hadn`t been able to make out the face?
sentences.chinese: 连那张面孔都没看清楚我怎么能肯定那就是她呢？

sentences.english: Better organization can help you see more clearly, without obsessing.
sentences.chinese: 更合理地安排能够你看清本质，而不受到困扰。

sentences.english: With this chart, you can see what they mean.
sentences.chinese: 下面这个图可以让你看清上述的意思。

sentences.english: I saw the ball land on the line. So please go back and show the flag signal of ball "in".
sentences.chinese: 我看清楚球是压线，所以请你回去出示界内球旗示。

sentences.english: You needn’t have a clear view of the sky toexperience the starry night.
sentences.chinese: 你不需要看清天空，就享有一个星空璀璨的夜晚。

sentences.english: Maybe it’s just me, but I see a pattern here.
sentences.chinese: 也许只有我这样看，不过，我看清了这里的模式。

sentences.english: Mr Li Xiaohe said that he and his family were able to see the monster clearly.
sentences.chinese: 李小和先生说他和家人看清楚了怪物。

sentences.english: Letting the user see clearly what functions are available is a fundamental principle of successful user interface design.
sentences.chinese: 让用户看清楚功能的合理性是成功用户界面的基准。

definition: to become aware/to detect/to realize/to perceive
clear/distinct/to understand thoroughly/to be clear about
to distinguish (between different things)/to make distinctions clear
to figure out how to do something
to sense/to perceive/to become aware of/to detect
